text:
The following list includes the names, locations, and categories of all the stars on the Hollywood Walk of Fame. The categories are motion pictures, television, recording, radio, live performance, and sports entertainment. The list does not include a star's name until his or her award ceremony has taken place, not at the time of nomination or an accepted nomination.

The stars are ordered alphabetically by surname, and all names are shown as they appear on the stars. All entries can be found on the Hollywood Walk of Fame website maintained by the Hollywood Chamber of Commerce (see the External links section below). As of October 19, 2023, there are 2,764 stars on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.[1]

Notes [ edit ]

^ [2] The star for film and television actor Edward Arnold indicates "Recording", not "Motion pictures", same as the star for country music singer Eddy Arnold ^ The text on Bradley's star includes his term as mayor: "Mayor Tom Bradley 1973—1993" ^ [3] Merian Cooper's star is misspelled as "Meriam". ^ [6] Lotte Lehmann star misspelled as "Lottie". ^ [7] Mary Livingstone's star is misspelled as "Livingston". ^ [8] Auguste Lumière star misspelled as "August". ^ [10] Henry O'Neill's star is misspelled as "O'Neil". ^ [11] Dorothy Phillips' star is misspelled as "Philips". ^ [12] Ernest Schoedsack's star is misspelled as "Shoedsach". ^ [13] Tom Tully's star is incorrectly rendered as "Thomas L Tully".
